key_points: Louis Capriotti, 45, of Chicago Heights was arrested for threatening to kill Democrats during Biden's inauguration.
The threat was made in a voicemail to a US House member from New Jersey on Dec. 29.
Capriotti has allegedly left multiple disturbing messages to members of Congress previously.
He faces a charge of transmitting a threat in interstate commerce.
Capriotti could face a maximum sentence of five years in prison if convicted.
U.S. Attorney John R. Lausch Jr. emphasized the seriousness of threats against public servants.
The arrest follows the storming of the US Capitol by Trump supporters, which resulted in five deaths.
There's heightened concern about potential violence leading up to and during the inauguration.
President Trump approved an emergency declaration to boost security in Washington D.C.
An FBI memo warned of armed protests expected at all 50 state capitols and D.C. around the inauguration.
